thread.title: Kenya: Italian Firm to Complete Mwingi Water Pipeline
thread.title_full: Kenya: Italian Firm to Complete Mwingi Water Pipeline

title: Kenya: Italian Firm to Complete Mwingi Water Pipeline
text:
Kitonga was speaking at Kalatine trading centre, Mumoni South division, on Thursday during a public meeting on the project. 
He said residents of Kalatine, Mukong'a and Nguungani will also get water. 
During the meeting, Kitonga introduced officials of Markers Consulting, which is carrying out an environmental impact assessment. 
Area MP John Munuve and acting deputy county commissioner Brian Kipruto were present. 
Munuve said he has worked tirelessly to revive the project, which stalled for years after the first phase was completed. 
He urged residents not to frustrate workers or block the pipeline. 
"In just two years in office, I managed to touch the right button to unlock this project that had failed to take off for years. It was in line with my agenda to ensure I reduce the distance to water sources to two kilometres," Munuve said. 
He said his friendship with President Uhuru Kenyatta has made it possible for the work to resume. 
"Uhuru allowed this project to be undertaken in my area, even though you gave him negligible votes in 2013. You should remember to pay him back when the time comes." Munuve said. Kenya
